Job Title: Electrical Technician - West Hershey Plant

Location: Hershey, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA

Position:  Hourly

Sign On Bonus: $4000

The Hershey Company West Hershey plant is a Union plant producing products such as White & Dark Paste, Kisses, Nuggets, Milk Bars, Almond Bars, Rolo & Syrup, in a high-speed complex environment.

Pay: 

Starting Pay is $38.30 per hour

75 cent per hour shift differential for working 2nd or 3rd shift

OT Potential!

$4000 Sign-On Bonus!

Manufacturing Incentive Plan (MIP) Eligible

Total Rewards

 Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, & Vision)—Starting Day 1! 401(k) Retirement Plan – with generous company match Hershey Stock Purchase Program Tuition Reimbursement Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability

Shifts: 

 We require that you are flexible to work any shift, weekends, overtime, and holidays. Schedule assignments upon hire are determined by plant needs and will be discussed during the interview process.

Candidate Process: 

 Qualified applicants will need to successfully complete an electrical written skills assessment. Those receiving a passing score will advance to an onsite electrical hands-on assessment and interview with the hiring team.

Summary:

This position requires Industrial Electrical/PLC experience in the food Industry with the knowledge of motors, industrial wiring, electro-mechanical drives, PLC application software/hardware and servo motion control applications.

This position also requires excellent trouble shooting and communication skills as well as the ability to effectively participate in a team-oriented work environment.

Major Duties/Responsibilities

Assemble, install, test and maintain electrical or electronic wiring, equipment, apparatus and fixtures, using hand tools and power tools.Diagnose malfunctioning system, apparatus, and components using test equipment and hand tools, to locate the cause of a breakdown and correct the problem.Inspect electrical systems, equipment, and components to identify hazards, defects, and the need for adjustment or repair, and to ensure compliance with codes.Test electrical system and continuity of circuits in electrical wiring, equipment and fixtures, using testing devices such ohmmeters, voltmeters, and oscilloscopes, to ensure compatibility and safety of system.Accept full responsibility for all safety procedures as stated in the JSA (Job Safety Analysis)Demonstrate self-motivational drive in learning new technologies as they applyCommunicate appropriately with the operators, mechanics, other electricians, engineers, supervisors and Plant leadershipPerform business management duties such as maintaining records and files, Understand and help maintain work orders, preventative maintenance system and in SAPWork from ladders and lifts to install, maintain or repair electrical wiring, equipment and fixtures.Read and interpret electrical schematicsDemonstrate the initiative to investigate and offer improvements to our plant operationService, clean, and inspect equipment periodically following established PMs (Preventative Maintenance)Safely operate mobile equipment such as fork trucks, hand trucks, lifts, boom lifts etc.Utilize problem solving techniques in interacting with other employees in resolving issuesAdhere to LOTO (Lock Out Tag Out) procedureHave a basic understanding of belts, belt drives, chain drives, gear boxes, and conveyorsCreate notifications and follow up on repairs.Evaluate and make recommendations to change PM (Preventative Maintenance) schedule or contentsMake up a bill of materials as requiredRead and interpret written description or engineering blueprintsPM and trouble shoot Motoman and ABB Robots.Learn and work with programs like Panelview, Factory Talk, RS Logix, Siemens.Direct and train others to install, maintain, or repair electrical wiring, equipment. Be able to provide expert knowledge and guidance to other employees in your field.

Other requirements:

Follow all safety requirements including but not limited to Adhere to SDS (Safety Data Sheet), LOTO, Confined Space, Fall protection, Electrical Flash NFPA 70-E etc.Follow all Food Manufacturing rules and regulations including but not limited to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP’s) and Safe Quality Foods (SQF).Demonstrate Hershey valuesUse of PPE (Personal Protective Equipment)Maintain Good Housekeeping skills

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
